title: Cain and Abel
summary: Genesis 4 shares the story of Cain and Abel, the first children of Adam and Eve. Cain kills his brother out of jealousy, showing how sin continues to grow.

faq.question: Why was Cain’s offering rejected?
faq.answer: God saw Cain’s heart. Abel gave with faith, but Cain's offering wasn’t given in the same spirit.

faq.question: What does God’s protection over Cain show?
faq.answer: It shows that even when we sin, God shows mercy and grace.

faq.question: Marked Protection
faq.answer: God’s mark on Cain served as a divine sign of protection. Marks, seals, or tattoos were used in various cultures to identify status or invoke protection.

faq.question: City-building by Outcasts
faq.answer: Cain, though cursed, builds a city. Founding a city was often a way to reclaim honor or establish legacy, even for those cast out.

faq.question: Blood as Sacred
faq.answer: In ancient cultures, blood symbolized life and justice. Abel’s blood crying out from the ground reflects the belief that innocent blood demanded divine response.

faq.question: Offerings to Deity
faq.answer: Presenting offerings was a common form of worship and devotion in ancient cultures. Cain and Abel each brought offerings to God based on their vocations.
